__data__.text:
## Activate License:

[https://www.youtube.com/embed/MZrpCgzt70s?si=KbQgwN0mg1_cZj3u](https://www.youtube.com/embed/MZrpCgzt70s?si=KbQgwN0mg1_cZj3u)



Please follow the instructions in the video to see how you can install WordPress on your hosting:

1. Step 01: Go to [Download](https://themeforest.net/downloads) Link
2. Step 02: Download your purchase code in pdf or text format.
3. Step 03: Copy purchase code.
4. Step 04: Go to your admin panel, And click "Histudy Menu". Then click Activate license
5. Step 05: Insert your purchase code ( you've already copyed from step 03) and email.

### Here are image instruction to follow.

![Download your purchase code](img/license/license-download.png)

*Download your purchase code in pdf or text format*

![Copy purchase code](img/license/copy_purchase_code.png)

*Copy purchase code*

![Go to your admin panel, And click Histudy Menu Then click Activate license](img/license/histudy-admin-panel.png)

*"Histudy Menu" => Activate license*

![Insert your purchase code ( you've already copyed from step 03) and email.](img/license/license-form.jpg)

*Insert your purchase code ( you've already copyed from step 03) and email.*

![If you're insert a valid license key, then you'll see this dashboard](img/license/histudy-dashboard.jpg)

*If you're insert a valid license key, then you'll see this dashboard*

![If you're insert a valid license key, then you'll see this dashboard](img/license/license-status.png)

*Now click "license info" menu to see all your license information.*

## Add Course[](#auction_course_title)

Please follow the instructions below:

1. From the dashboard go to Tutor LMS  Courses Add new and Name of the course
2. Course Description
3. Select Course Image
4. Select Course categories
5. Select Course tag
6. Course Short Discription
7. Course Additional Option
8. Tutor Course Meta
9. Author Select
10. Course Settings -> General
11. Add Product
12. Course Builder
13. Additional Data
14. Video
15. Click Publish Button

## Basic Information

![Click switch to Add Product](img/histudy/course/creation/1.png)

## Course Settings

![Click switch to Add Product](img/histudy/course/creation/2.png)

## Change Site Title and Favicon

To change your Site title and Favicon login to wp-admin and navigate to Dashboard AppearanceCustomizeSite Identity and follow the following steps:

![go to Appearance -> Import Demo Data](img/histudy/basic-setting/title-and-favicon.png)

*go to Dashboard > Appearance > Customize > Site Identity and change it.*

## Change Logo

To change your Site logo, login to wp-admin and go to Dashboard Histudy Theme OptionsGeneral and follow the following steps:

![Go to Dashboard > Histudy Theme Options > General > upload your logo from here.](img/histudy/basic-setting/logo.png)

*Go to Dashboard > Histudy Theme Options > General > upload your logo from here.*

## Setting a Home Page and Blog Page

To set the home and blog page, login to wp-admin and go to Dashboard Settings Reading and follow the following steps:

![Go to Dashboard > Settings > Reading > upload your logo from here.](img/histudy/basic-setting/set-home.png)

*Select your Home and Blog Page.*

## Customize Menu

To set the menus, login to wp-admin and go to Dashboard Appearance Menus  and follow the following steps:

![Customize the menu.](img/histudy/basic-setting/menu.png)

*Customize the menu 1*

## One page Navigation

1. Prepare the **page**
2. Create a new page. To do that go to Pages Add New  and give the page a title and then add a Block element to the content. Add section unique  **"ID"** into Per Block.
3. Prepare the **menu**
4. Go to Appearance Menu click the create a new menu link  Give the new menu a unique name and then click the Create Menu button.
5. Add menu item with **section ID**
6. Select Onepage menu for this page from page attributes options

![Create a page](img/histudy/onepage/1.png)

*01. **Create a page***

![One page navigation.](img/histudy/onepage/2.png)

*02. **Add content block with "unique ID"***

![One page navigation.](img/histudy/onepage/3.png)

*03. **Create a new menu for one page***

![One page navigation.](img/histudy/onepage/4.png)

*04. **Add custom link item with section id***

![One page navigation.](img/histudy/onepage/5.png)

*05. **Set One page menu***

![One page navigation.

**Set One page menu***

![One page navigation.](img/histudy/onepage/6.png)

*06. **From page attributes section***

![One page navigation.](img/histudy/onepage/7.png)

*07. **One Page Preview***

#### For different Home Pages, there is the pre-made menu.

- **home** - For Main Demo Page
- **Main Menu** - For Inner Page/ Multi-Page Demo
- **Consulting** - For Sidenav menu
- - and more

#### You can also use **external link** with one page menu.

1. Go to Appearance Menu click the menu item arrow icon
2. Select **Yes** form External link

![External link 1](img/histudy/onepage/11.png)

*01. **External link***

![External link 2](img/histudy/onepage/12.png)

*02. **Select Yes***

## Turn on Coming Soon/Maintenance Mode

WordPress Maintenance Mode: What Is It and How to Use It. <https://elementor.com/blog/wordpress-maintenance-mode/>

1. Get back to the WordPress Dashboard and navigate to Elementor Tools Maintenance Mode
2. Choose between **Coming Soon** and **Maintenance Mode**
3. Pick the template for the **Coming Soon** Mode. Template name **"Coming Soon"**
> **Note:** You will see a red button on your top WordPress bar with the text: **" Maintenance Mode ON"**.
> **Tip:** You can use the same process described here for "Maintenance Mode"

![coming soon 1](img/histudy/coming-soon/1.png)

*Elementor > Tools > Maintenance Mode*

![coming soon 2](img/histudy/coming-soon/2.png)

*Choose between **Coming Soon** and **Maintenance Mode***

![coming soon 3](img/histudy/coming-soon/3.png)

*Pick the template for the **Coming Soon** Mode. Template name **"Coming Soon"** and click the save change button*

![coming soon 4](img/histudy/coming-soon/4.png)

*Maintenance Mode ON*

![coming soon 4](img/histudy/coming-soon/5.png)

*Active Coming Soon Mode*

## Contact Form

We are using plugin "Contact Form 7" for contact functionality. You can see their documentation for better understanding. <https://contactform7.com/docs/>

If you don't want to go through all the troubles to check their documentation and just want to use the default contact form we provided with this theme, please at least set up the default emails in contact form settings. To do that, please follow the steps below:

1. Get back to the WordPress Dashboard and navigate to Contact Contact Form
2. Choose between **Histudy Contact Form**
3. Click the edit link
4. and then go to the "mail" tab

![Change Global Color Options Setting](img/histudy/contact/contact-1.png)

*Contact Form Mail Tab*

## Elementor Elements/Widget

Elementor Page Builder has a lot of built-in widgets by default. But for your convenience we've created 30+ custom Elementor Widgets that you can use in your website and extend website functionality. You can find them under **RAINBOW ELEMENTS** section on Elementor edit mode.

![Change Global Color Options Setting](img/histudy/elementor/elementor-widget.png)

*Elementor Custom Widget/Addons*

## Allow Account Registration[](#allow-account-registration)

To allow for account registration

Please make sure that in Dashboard Settings General Anyone can register is turned on

And also in Woocommerce Settings Accounts and Privacy Allow customers to create an account on the "My account" page

![reg settings](img/histudy/woocommerce/reg_settings.png)

*Anyone can register*

![allow_customer](img/histudy/woocommerce/allow_customer.png)

*Allow customers to create an account*

# Getting Started

Welcome to Histudy! We would like to thank you for choosing our theme Histudy.

Histudy is created for Learning Management System. Online OR Offline The template is perfect for e-Learning, Course School, Online School, Kindergarten, Classic LMS, University Status, Instructor Portfolio, Language Academy, Gym Coaching, Online Course, Single Course, marketplace, University Classic, Home Elegant, Home technology, and other needed dashboard, inner and details pages availability. The template has included everything you need for a complete online education center and LMS.

## Requirements

There are system requirements in order to install and setup Histudy theme and its components properly. Make sure that you are running the **latest version of WordPress,** **PHP version 5.6** or higher and **MySQL version 5.6** or higher. We also recommend the following PHP configuration limits. <https://wordpress.org/about/requirements/>

### Recommended PHP configuration limits

  
    max_execution_time = 300;
    upload_max_filesize = 128M;
    post_max_size = 128M;
    max_input_time = 300;
    memory_limit = 256M;
  
  

## What's Included

After purchasing Histudy Theme on themeforest.net with your Envato account, go to your Download page. You can choose to download Histudy Theme only (Installable WordPress Theme) or the entire Histudy Theme package which contains the following files:

![whats-included](img/histudy/included/1.png)

### The contents of the theme package downloaded from ThemeForest:

- **histudy.zip** - An Installable WordPress Theme zip file. this file you need to upload to WordPress.
- **histudy-child.zip** - This file contains the basic child theme that you can use with our theme. Just installing it won’t hurt and in case you decide to make some changes/extend the source code of the theme, it will be very helpful because it helps not to lose your custom changes after updating the parent theme. [More on child themes](https://codex.wordpress.org/Child_Themes)
- **Plugins** - This folder contains plugins required to work with our theme.
- **Demo Data** - This folder contains the demo content file which will help you to import the demo manually.
- **Licensing** - This folder contains the terms and conditions of the license.
- **Documentation** - This folder contains what you are reading now :)

## Global Color Options

To change Global Color Options setting, navigate to Appearance Customize Histudy Color Options Global Colors

![Change Global Color Options Setting](img/histudy/theme-options/global_color_options.png)

*Change Global Color Options Setting*

## Importing Demo Contents

- [One Click Import](#one_click_import_alternative)
- [Manually Import](#manually_import)


### One Click Method

Want to build your site like the demo? You can do it by only one click! Histudy an easy solution for the demo content you saw on our preview website. Please follow the instructions below:
> **Note:** Please remember that when you are done with the demo import, your some existing settings will be replaced by the demo contents Like: Your menu, Customizer. So it is recommended that you should only do this in fresh site.

1. Ensure, that the **One-Click Import** plugin is installed and activated;
2. From the dashboard go to Appearance Import Demo Data
3. Choose the demo you want to install and click on the **“Import”** button​ below​;
4. **And change the permalink:** From the dashboard go to Settings Permalink

![go to Appearance -> Import Demo Data](img/histudy/demo-import/1.png)

*go to Appearance -> Import Demo Data*

![Click on the Import button](img/histudy/demo-import/2.png)

*Click on the "Import" button*

![Click Yes, Import Button](img/histudy/demo-import/3.png)

*Click "Yes, Import" Button*

![Import Complete!](img/histudy/demo-import/5.png)

***Import Complete!** Congrats, your demo was imported successfully. You can now begin editing your site.*

![Change permalink](img/histudy/demo-import/4.png)

*Change permalink*

### Manually Import

Please follow the instructions below:

1. Click **switch to manual import** from right corner.
2. Choose **content.xml** file for all content import
3. Choose **widget.wie** file for widget import
4. Choose **customizer.dat** file for customizer import
5. Choose **redux_options.dat** file for theme options import. Redux option name: **“histudy_options”**
6. and last click **Import demo data** button
> **Note:** We have added all the above files to the **Theme package -> Demo Data** folder.

![Click switch to manual import link](img/histudy/demo-import/menual/1.png)

*Click "switch to manual import" link*

![Choose all file and click the import demo data button](img/histudy/demo-import/menual/2.png)

*Choose all file and click the "import demo data" button*

## Installing the theme
> **Important!** if you download the All Files archive from ThemeForest and try to upload it to your WordPress, you will receive this error: **Theme is missing the style.css stylesheet.** Please make sure you unzipped the main archive and are uploading the correct file to your WordPress.

When you are ready to install a theme, you must first upload the theme files and then activate the theme itself. The theme files can be uploaded in two ways:

**How to Setup and Demo Import (Video)**: <https://youtu.be/ctsT5Y-InqE>

### 1. Using Theme Uploader

Follow the steps as instructed in the images below:

1. From the dashboard go to AppearanceThemesAdd New Upload Theme
2. Click on  **“Choose File”** and select **histudy.zip**
3. Click on **“Install Now”**.
4. Active the Theme

![Appearance → Themes → Add New](img/histudy/theme-upload-and-active/1.png)

*Appearance → Themes → Add New*

![Upload Theme](img/histudy/theme-upload-and-active/2.png)

*Click on “Choose File” and select histudy.zip and Click on “Install Now”.*

![Choose File](img/histudy/theme-upload-and-active/3.png)

*Active Histudy Theme*

### 2. Using FTP Clients

Follow the following steps to upload your theme using FTP clients:

1. Use an FTP such as FileZilla and go to your WordPress installation director
2. Navigate to **/wp-content/themes/** folder and upload the theme folder there
3. Log in to your WP Admin Dashboard and open the AppearanceThemes menu
4. You will now see **Histudy** Theme listed among the other themes. **Click on Activate** and you’re done!

### 3. Updating the theme

We recommend that you use the Envato Market plugin to keep the theme up-to-date.

1. Download the Envato Market plugin from here: <http://envato.github.io/wp-envato-market/dist/envato-market.zip>
2. Install the plugin from PluginsAdd New
3. Once installed, you should see an **Envato Market menu** on the admin sidebar. Click on it.
4. Enter your Envato API Personal Token in the Token field. If you don’t have an API token you can create one here or click on the generate a personal token link on that page.
5. Once you have pasted your token in the Token field, click on **Save Changes**.
6. Should your token be correct, two extra tabs are now available on your Envato Market page.

Should your token be correct, two extra tabs are now available on your Envato Market page. Click on the Plugins tab.

![Enter your Envato API Personal Token.](img/histudy/update/1.png)

*Enter your Envato API Personal Token.*
> If an update is available for the Histudy Theme, click on the Update Available link, which should start installing your update.

Envato Market Plugin Official Site: <https://envato.com/market-plugin/>

### 4. Installing required plugins

Histudy Theme requires a set of core and additional plugins to function correctly. A plugin is an additional component that offers functionality and features beyond a typical WordPress installation. Without them, most of its functionality is not available. After installing the theme you will be prompted to install the required plugins at the top of your dashboard.

1. From the dashboard go to Appearance Install Plugins
2. Toggle all the required plugins and hint **“Install”**;
3. The last step will be activating the plugins.

![Click on the begin installing plugins link to install all the required plugins.](img/histudy/active-plugins/1.png)

*Click on the begin installing plugins link to install all the required plugins.*

![Select all and install](img/histudy/active-plugins/2.png)

*Select all and install*

![Select all and Activate](img/histudy/active-plugins/3.png)

*Select all and Activate*

## General Settings
> **Info!** Our platform offers extensive customization options for logos, allowing you to create unique variations to perfectly represent your brand. You can easily adjust padding to ensure your logo fits seamlessly within your design, enhancing the overall aesthetic appeal. Additionally, you have the flexibility to enable or disable the "Back to Top" button based on your website's user experience requirements. These features provide you with the control to histudy your site's visual and functional elements, ensuring a professional and user-friendly interface that aligns with your brand's identity and your audience's needs.

![General Theme Options](img/theme-options/settings-general.png)

*General Theme Options*

## Site Information
> **Info!** Easily customize your site with the HiStudy theme. Histudy logo variations, adjust padding, and enable or disable the "Back to Top" button to suit your needs, ensuring a professional and user-friendly experience.

Button Type: You can set button type from this field.

## General

To change Histudy General Options navigate to Appearance Histudy Theme Options General

General menu contains such tabs as website logo settings.

The logo can be uploaded in 3 variants. This is very helpful in case you have pages with different backgrounds and are using a transparent header. It makes you available to choose the logo which looks the best for each of your pages individually.

![general](img/histudy/theme-options/general.png)

*General*
